title: US Tech Enables China To Track Movement Of Tibetan Refugees In Nepal
content: Nepal is just one of at least 150 countries to which Chinese companies are supplying surveillance technology, from cameras in Vietnam to censorship firewalls in Pakistan to citywide monitoring systems in Kenya.

title: "To Protect Victims": Trump Administration On Partial Release Of Epstein Files
content: Friday's partial release of the Epstein files has led to a new crush of criticism from Democrats who have accused the Republican administration of trying to hide information.

title: Residents Of South Delhi Colony Form Human Chain In Protest Against MCD Over Garbage, Illegal Parking
content: Traffic on the road connecting south Delhi's Okhla with other neighbourhoods came to a standstill for 15 minutes on Sunday after hundreds of residents came out in protest against the Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD).

title: Analysis | Local Body Poll Results Validation Of E Shinde In Maharashtra Politics
content: Municipal council elections in Maharashtra, which happened after almost a decade, mirrored the 2024 Vidhan Sabha elections.

title: Minority Vote Calculus: Vijay's TVK In Poll Race, DMK's Christmas Outreach
content: In a significant political signal, the DMK shifted its annual Christmas celebrations - usually held in Chennai - to Tirunelveli in southern Tamil Nadu, a region with a substantial Christian population.

title: Suspended Trinamool Leader Humayun Kabir To Float His Own Party Tomorrow
content: A day before announcing his new political party on Monday, the now-suspended Trinamool Congress legislator Humayun Kabir, on Sunday, gave a call to all "anti-Trinamool Congress" and "anti- Bharatiya Janata Party" (BJP) forces to get united.

title: IndiGo To Issue Rs 10,000 Travel Vouchers To Stranded Passengers From December 26
content: Indian carrier IndiGo will start compensating passengers affected by widespread flight cancellations earlier this month, from next week.

title: BJP Emerges As Largest Party In Maharashtra Local Polls, Alliance Wins Big
content: The Mahayuti alliance of the BJP, Shiv Sena, and NCP has swept the elections to 288 municipal councils and nagar panchayats by winning 207 posts of presidents of local bodies today.

title: With Tech Surveillance, 3rd Accused In Naval Spying Case Arrested
content: A 34-year-old resident of Gujarat has been arrested by Karnataka's Udupi Police in connection with an investigation into leak of sensitive Indian Navy data to unauthorised foreign entities.

title: Pollution, Flood, Water Crisis: Environmentalist On Top Court's Aravalli Order
content: The Aravallis are the green lungs of Delhi and keep clean the environment of the national capital by helping with the absorption of particulate matters - a crucial point to be remembered every winter, said environmentalist Bhavreen Kandhari.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Telangana A Lab For Congress's Minority Policy
content: One of the that catapulted Revanth Reddy to the Chief Minister's chair in Telangana is his aggression. He does not believe in keeping it subtle when he wants to drive a point home.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Pawan Kalyan: Reel Meets Real
content: In his avatar as deputy chief minister of Andhra Pradesh, Kalyan is playing the sincere, goody-goody guy who asks tough questionssomeone who is willing to take on a fellow cabinet minister for the sake of the larger public good.

title: People In Live-In Relationships Not Ready To Take Responsibility: Mohan Bhagwat
content: Claiming that people in live-in relationships are "not ready to take responsibility," Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) chief Mohan Bhagwat on Sunday highlighted the importance of maintaining the family structure in society.

title: Debate Settled Over Real Shiv Sena: Eknath Shinde After Local Body Poll Win
content: Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister and Shiv Sena Chief leader Eknath Shinde said on Sunday that the party has maintained a formidable strike rate in the recent nagar parishad and nagar panchayat elections.

title: Karnataka Leadership Confusion Is Local, Not At High Command Level: M Kharge
content: Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge on Sunday clarified that the confusion over the leadership issue in the party's Karnataka unit exists only at the local level and not within the party high command.

title: Meat, Alcohol, Tobacco Banned In 3 Holy Cities In Punjab
content: The sale of meat, tobacco, alcohol, other intoxicants are now prohibited in Amritsar Walled City, Talwandi Sabo and Sri Anandpur Sahib after a notification was issued by the Punjab government, according them 'holy city' status.

title: Gujarat Student, Forced To Join Russian Army, Sends SOS Video From Ukraine
content: A young man from Gujarat, who went to Russia for studies on a student visa, has in a video message requested people not to join the Russian military under any circumstances.

title: "He Puts Everything On Opposition": PM Modi vs M Kharge On Infiltration
content: The Congress-BJP divide over the issue of illegal immigrants has escalated, with Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Congress chief Mallikarjun Kharge going toe-to-toe today.

title: Remain Calm Even In Complex Situations, Top Court Judge Advises Judges
content: Supreme Court judge, Justice Prashant Kumar Mishra, said on Sunday that the district judiciary is the most important in the judicial system and advised judges to remain peaceful, calm and composed even in complex situations.

title: Kerala Says Schools Will Not Be Allowed To Become "Communal Labs"
content: Kerala government on Sunday warned that schools would not be allowed to be turned into "communal laboratories."

title: Browns standout rookie RB Judkins carted off
content: Browns rookie running back Quinshon Judkins left Sunday's game against the Buffalo Bills on a cart after suffering a right leg injury.

title: Lindsey leaves Michigan to become Missouri OC
content: Missouri has hired Michigan's Chip Lindsey as offensive coordinator, with sources saying he agreed to a three-year contract.

title: Jayhawks asst. Dooley suspended after DUI arrest
content: Kansas men's basketball assistant coach Joe Dooley was arrested on suspicion of driving under the influence and failure to stop at an accident and will be suspended for three weeks, coach Bill Self announced.

title: Eagles go for 2, igniting brawl; Sirianni backs play
content: An on-field fight resulted in three players being ejected from Saturday's Eagles-Commanders game after Philadelphia, up by 17 late in the fourth quarter, decided to go for a 2-point conversion.

title: Devils' Jack Hughes returns after 'freak' injury
content: Devils star Jack Hughes, who injured his hand during a team dinner in Chicago on Nov. 13, will return to the lineup against the Sabres.

title: Lanning: Ducks fell short of 'standard' in CFP win
content: Dan Lanning expressed disappointment with how Oregon performed in the second half versus James Madison, despite advancing in the College Football Playoff for the first time since 2014.

title: Japan HR record-setter Murakami picks ChiSox
content: Japanese slugger Munetaka Murakami, who hit 56 home runs in Nippon Professional Baseball in 2022, is joining the White Sox.

title: Humphries Armbruster slides to 1st win as mom
content: Kaillie Humphries Armbruster has won dozens of races in her bobsled career. The victory she got Sunday was like none of the others: her first since becoming a mother.

title: üèà NFL playoffs: Projections, postseason chances
content: We're looking ahead to how the 14-team playoff picture could line up -- and who will win divisions -- en route to Super Bowl LX.

title: CFP first-round takeaways: Miami's run game, special teams woes and blowouts
content: After two nail-biters and two one-sided scores, we've got our quarterfinals. Here's what we've learned from this weekend's games.

content: Must-win for the Lions? Who takes control of the NFC South? Can the Jaguars upset the Broncos? We have picks, predictions and stats for every game.

content: The all-SEC showdown features big hitters who have beome quite comfortable on the biggest stage. So what are the X factors?

title: Week 16 betting guide: Backing Maye to throw Patriots to victory
content: Our experts dive into the lines and player props that offer value for Week 16 and share their tips and bets.

title: Liverpool's win marred by Isak injury as pressure mounts on Spurs' Frank
content: Liverpool's third straight win in all competitions came at a cost while furthering Spurs fans' frustration with Thomas Frank.

title: The Jake Paul show is far from over, but where does it go from here?
content: Even in defeat, Jake Paul's boxing career is far from over, but his next move could be one of the most important yet.

title: Tag team title match leaves something to be desired
content: A disappointing end to the men's tag team championship, was emblematic of a building-block 'SmackDown.'

title: Transfer rumors, news: Real Madrid, Man City, Liverpool eye Bayern star Olise
content: Bayern Munich's Michael Olise is wanted by a host of other top European clubs. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: SIR in T.N. leads to deletion of 2.6 lakh more women than men from electoral rolls
content: Data points to marriage-related migration being the cause behind higher deletions of women‚Äôs names from electoral rolls

title: A gripping account from prison and a powerful argument for reforms
content: The book Oru Thooku Kaithiyin Vaakumoolam, authored by Selvam, who was once condemned to death for a murder, goes far beyond his personal story and his 31 years in prison. It provides a detailed account of the turf wars that engulfed Kanniyakumari district in the late 1980s

title: President grants assent to SHANTI Bill that opens up nuclear sector for private participation
content: The law enables private companies and joint ventures to build, own, operate and decommission nuclear power plants under a license from the government

title: Watch: Centre rejects mining claims, says Aravalli hills remain protected
content: The Centre has rejected reports that the definition of the Aravalli hills was changed to permit large-scale mining, citing a Supreme Court-ordered freeze on new leases. The clarification follows controversy over the ‚Äú100-metre‚Äù criterion used to define hills across states.

title: Suspended Trinamool MLA Humayun Kabir announces plans to float new political party
content: The announcement of the construction of Babri Masjid at Beldanga that has drawn large crowds to the venue; Every day, hundreds of people bring bricks to the venue and offer donations for the construction of the mosque

title: Bengal police warn against drawing a parallel between Bangladesh murder and Murshidabad lynching
content: The police warn of action against those attempting to communalise criminal incidents. Several BJP leaders had made references to the lynching of a father-son duo in Murshidabad in April 2025, against the backdrop of the recent murder of Dipu Chandra Das in Bangladesh.

title: Newly elected local body members in Ernakulam take oath amid cheers
content: A total of 2,220 representatives, elected to 111 local bodies in the district, took oath at different venues. As many as 1,467 members in 82 grama panchayats, 202 in 14 block panchayats, and 447 members in 13 municipalities also took oath at the respective centres

title: Uproar over attack on meat shop owner in U.P.‚Äôs Aligarh
content: Opposition alleges attempt to create fear, says fringe Hindutva elements vitiating communal harmony of society

title: Gandhi lives in the people‚Äôs hearts: Congress leader Karra
content: J&K Congress president and legislator Tariq Hamid Karra raised anti-government and pro-Gandhi slogans along with his supporters

title: Maharashtra local body poll results: PM Modi thanks people of for supporting BJP-led Mahayuti
content: The State Election Commission has not yet declared the results of all 286 municipal councils and nagar panchayats, which went to polls in two phases on December 2 and 20

title: Jammu youth open up about issues facing region at PDP‚Äôs Gal Baath initiative
content: Several speakers highlighted the reservation policy that¬†puts open merit students at a disadvantage with only 30% quota

title: Nainar Nagenthran reminds T.N. Minister about the plight of Arvind Kejriwal
content: BJP leader says the DMK is underestimating the political and administrative capabilities of Union Home Minister Amit Shah and slams ‚ÄòTASMAC Minister‚Äô

title: SHANTI Bill not only for Trump but also for Adani: Congress
content: Congress general secretary (communications) Jairam Ramesh alleged that the nuclear energy legislation was pushed through Parliament to favour U.S. interests and Adani Group‚Äôs entry into the sector

title: BJP dominates panchayat polls in Arunachal, wins bulk of ZPM, GPM seats
content: The Peoples' Party of Arunachal (PPA) emerged as the second-largest force with 28 seats, while the Congress secured seven seats in the zila parishad constituencies

title: Coal block allocation case petitioner lawyer M.L. Sharma passes away
content: He filed multiple public interest litigations, notably on the abrogation of Article 370, the Pegasus spyware controversy, and the Rafale case

title: Chalachitra Academy‚Äôs stand on denial of censor exemption to films at IFFK slammed
content: Resul Pookutty, the Oscar-winning artistic director of the festival made a shocking statement by resorting to the usual ‚Äúanti-national‚Äù rhetoric that the BJP is famous for, says statement

title: APSSDC picks 110 to represent Andhra Pradesh at regional IndiaSkills competitions
content: Candidates selected from 54,000 registrants across 48 skill trades; winners to compete at regional level in February 2026, leading to WorldSkills Shanghai

title: Walayar mob lynching: K.C. Venugopal calls State government‚Äôs apathy shocking
content: AICC general secretary demands compensation for victim‚Äôs family, strict action against those responsible

title: Political conspiracy behind construction of Babri Masjid will broaden rift, says RSS chief
content: The remark by the RSS chief comes in the wake of a call given by suspended Trinamool Congress MP Humayun Kabir to construct ‚ÄòBabri Masjid‚Äô at Beldanga in Murshidabad district.

title: Vikasit Chhattisgarh within reach as anti-Naxal operations gain ground: Chief Minister
content: Vishnu Deo Sai says ending Left Wing Extremism will unlock the State‚Äôs mineral and forest wealth and accelerate development through improved inter-State connectivity

title: Congress slams government for ‚Äòdismantling‚Äô MGNREGA after passage of VB-G Ram G Bill
content: Party leader K.C. Venugopal says the Modi government had effectively dismantled the MGNREGA by converting it from a right to a favour

title: Stand-off at Thrissur MCH as Walayar lynching victim‚Äôs family refuses to receive body
content: Family of migrant worker Ram Narayan demands ‚Çπ25 lakh compensation, mob-lynching charges, and state support to transport body home

title: Odisha Governor lays stress on cultural integration at ABVP State convention
content: Haribabu  urges the youth wing to launch a tirade against rampant drug menace in the country and create awareness among fellow students on the impact of substance abuse

title: Snowfall ends long dry spell, heralds the revival of festive year-end tourism in Kashmir Valley
content: Tourists were mesmerised by a thick, white blanket of snow, setting the stage for Christmas and New Year celebrations, and winter sports in the Valley

title: TTD donates breath analysers to Tirupati police
content: They help in preventing road accidents and ensuring adherence to traffic rules, says Executive Officer Anil Kumar Singhal after handing over the gadgets to Superintendent of Police Subbarayudu

title: Local body polls 2025: members take oath in local bodies across Kerala, spotlight on Thiruvananthapuram Corporation
content: In the 2025 local body elections, the Thiruvananthapuram Corporation had witnessed a seismic shift with the LDF losing its grip on the 101-ward civic body after more than four decades.

title: Justice delayed: consumers caught in a web of systemic inconsistencies
content: Long travel, repeated adjournments and mounting backlogs are turning consumer courts into a test of endurance for litigants.

title: Post deadline extension, Waqf Board deals with  new challenges
content: Focus will be on registering the 3,000 institutions enumerated under kitabul waqf, and 13,000 registered under second waqf survey

title: Post-SIR, size of electorate in Chennai and nearby districts remains larger than votes polled in 2021 and 2026 polls
content: Only in four constituencies ‚Äî Villivakkam, R.K. Nagar, Perambur, and Anna Nagar ‚Äî did the number of votes polled in 2021 exceed the revised strength of the electorate

title: SIT seeks VSSC expertise to quantify original gold content in Sabarimala temple‚Äôs gilded panels
content: VSSC‚Äôs metallurgical analysis report may provide SIT with a scientific baseline for comparing metallurgical nature of the original gilded panels with those returned to the temple after restoration by prime accused Unnikrishnan Potti in 2019

title: Thrissur Corporation councillors, district panchayat members take oath
content: All 56 councillors sworn in as first council meeting held; oath ceremony of district panchayat members  held at  District Planning Bhavan

title: CREDAI thanks government for amending building rules in Andhra Pradesh
content: The changes ensure alignment with prominent national jurisdictions and provide clear regulatory certainty for both developers and approving authorities, say CREDAI office-bearers

title: Karnataka notifies auction of 569 liquor vends in January to raise resources
content: State hopes to raise between ‚Çπ600 crore and ‚Çπ1,000 crore through the e-auction announced by Chief Minister in the 2025-2026 Budget

title: Vijayanagara legacy offers lessons for inclusive growth: Nirmala Sitharaman
content: The Union Finance Minister visits UNESCO World Heritage site at Hampi in Vijayanagara along with a team of 120 officers from her Ministry

title: Human-wildlife conflict: Bhupender Yadav chairs meetings to review measures, discuss project updates
content: The Union Environment Minister underscores the importance of science-based management, landscape-level planning, community participation and inter-State coordination in India's globally recognised tiger conservation model

title: Judges must uphold values with discipline, legal knowledge, says SC judge
content: Advises judges to remain calm and composed even in complex situations and stressed on the importance of the district judiciary

title: TDP appoints new district presidents, general secretaries for 25 Parliamentary constituencies
content: A significant number of them belong to the Backward Classes, Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes, and Minorities

title: Local leaders creating confusion over leadership issue: Kharge
content: Congress chief says he will look into a letter sent by leaders to resolve the issue; DKS meets Rajanna, dismisses talk of rift with CM

title: Poll bonds scrapped by SC, trusts now swell BJP coffers with 84% of funds in 2024-25
content: Scrapping electoral bonds has surprisingly boosted BJP's donations, with electoral trusts disbursing over Rs 3,577 crore in 2024-25.  This marks a significant increase, with the party securing 83.6% of all trust contributions.  While corporate donors sought anonymity, the BJP remains the primary beneficiary of this funding route.

title: 'Eggs in India safe for consumption': FSSAI rejects cancer risk claim; explains how
content: FSSAI has strongly refuted claims linking eggs to cancer, stating that eggs sold in India are safe. The authority clarified that the presence of nitrofuran metabolites below regulatory detection thresholds does not pose a health risk, as the use of these banned antibiotics is strictly prohibited in poultry production.

title: Maha local body poll results: Mahayuti sweeps 207 posts; MVA restricted to 44
content: Maharashtra's local body elections saw a significant win for the BJP-led Mahayuti alliance, securing a majority of councillor seats and municipal council presidencies. The ruling coalition attributed its success to development initiatives and strong organizational efforts. Opposition parties, however, alleged irregularities and unfair practices during the polls.

title: 'Pak under Asim law': Jailed ex-PM Imran Khan flays army chief; calls for nation to rise
content: Imprisoned former Pakistan PM Imran Khan has called for nationwide protests and vowed to challenge the recent Toshakhana-II verdict, which he claims was delivered hastily and without evidence. Khan alleges he and his wife are subjected to harsh solitary confinement and criticizes army chief Asim Munir, stating Pakistan is governed by 'Asim Law'.

title: 'Learn these skills': JPMorgan Chase CEO advices people looking for jobs
content: JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon advises job seekers to focus on soft skills like emotional intelligence and communication, rather than technical tasks, as AI automates certain roles. He believes these human abilities are crucial for future employability, suggesting that while AI will eliminate jobs, new opportunities will emerge for those who adapt and learn.

title: Record! Mandhana becomes first Indian woman to achieve this rare feat
content: Smriti Mandhana made history in the first Women‚Äôs T20I against Sri Lanka by becoming the first Indian to score 4,000 T20I runs. She is only the second woman globally after Suzie Bates to achieve this feat and did it faster than anyone. India‚Äôs bowlers then restricted Sri Lanka to 121 runs.

title: Bezos' ex-wife's charity: Biggest annual donation of $7.1B in 2025; Amazon stake halved
content: MacKenzie Scott donated over $7.1 billion in 2025 to 186 organizations globally, including universities and environmental nonprofits. This marks her largest annual giveaway, with significant contributions to diversity and equity initiatives like Howard University and college access programs. Scott has also reduced her Amazon stake by $12.6 billion.

title: Bigg Boss Telugu 9 winner: Kalyan Padala lifts trophy, wins Rs 40 lakh
content: In an electrifying finale, Kalyan Padala emerged as the champion of Bigg Boss Telugu 9, besting fellow contestant Thanuja Puttaswamy. His victory earned him a whopping Rs 35 lakhs and a brand-new SUV, along with an extra Rs 5 lakhs for his exceptional gameplay.

title: Terrorists force villager to give food in Jammu & Kashmir, combing operation on
content: Terrorists forced a villager to provide food in Udhampur before escaping into a forest, triggering a massive search operation. Security forces have cordoned off the forest belt and launched a coordinated combing operation. This incident follows a previous encounter where a special operations group officer was killed.

title: 'Unusual': West mourns B'desh student leader's death; ex-diplomat flags anti-India agenda
content: Western embassies in Bangladesh issued condolence messages for student leader Sharif Osman Hadi. This move raised eyebrows due to Hadi's strong anti-India stance and his group's promotion of territorial claims. Questions arose regarding the consistency of Western support for democracy and minority rights with mourning a figure linked to a group advocating Sharia law. The incident highlights a diplomatic controversy.

title: Meta‚Äôs AI chief unhappy: Wang calls Zuckerberg ‚Äòsuffocating‚Äô; makes micromanagement claims
content: Meta's $14.8 billion investment in Scale AI and the integration of its CEO, Alexandr Wang, into a new "superintelligence" lab are reportedly facing internal friction. Wang allegedly finds Mark Zuckerberg's micromanagement "suffocating," while some staff question Wang's experience. This shift also clashes with Meta's open-source AI philosophy, leading to executive departures.

title: Woody Marks injury update: Insiders break silence as return vs Raiders remain unclear
content: The Houston Texans' star player, Woody Marks, was expected to return to the field today as the team gears up to face the Las Vegas Raiders. But his status has sparked chaos among fans as Woody Marks continues to deal with his ankle injury. Amid this, insiders have opened up about his status.

title: Lakers vs Clippers (Dec 20): Preview, lineups, injury report and how to watch
content: The Los Angeles Lakers, with a strong 19-7 record and recent offensive surge, face the struggling Los Angeles Clippers (6-21) tonight. The Lakers have been dominant since mid-November, especially with LeBron James healthy, while the Clippers are on an eight-game home losing streak. Luka Doncic led the Lakers to a season-high 143 points in their last outing.

title: The original 'Little Master': Hanif Mohammad, Pakistan‚Äôs first great Test batter
content: Pakistan's first cricketing icon, Hanif Mohammad, instilled a culture of resilience, teaching the nation how not to lose.  His extraordinary 970-minute innings against the West Indies in 1958, a testament to his defensive prowess and unwavering spirit, remains legendary.  This 'Little Master' transformed cricket into a sport for all, leaving an indelible mark on Pakistan's sporting identity.

title: Anthony Joshua net worth 2025: Boxing earnings, career and Jake Paul fight payday
content: Anthony Joshua's net worth is estimated at ¬£195 million in 2025, with the majority earned from boxing purses. He also generates significant income from endorsements and property investments. Joshua is set to earn a guaranteed ¬£70 million from his upcoming fight against Jake Paul, a professionally sanctioned eight-round heavyweight bout.

title: 'Recovery isn‚Äôt optional': Why Chiefs Heiress Gracie hunt chose strength in 2025
content: Chiefs heiress Gracie Hunt reveals she gained 15 lbs during her 2025 fitness journey, explaining why strength, recovery, and long-term health mattered more than appearance. The Kansas City Chiefs owner‚Äôs daughter shares how intentional training, muscle gain, and consistency helped her finish the year stronger than she started.

title: Brittany Mahomes silent as Randi shares hope amid Patrick Mahomes recovery
content: Patrick Mahomes‚Äô season-ending knee injury has left the Chiefs in unfamiliar territory. While Brittany Mahomes has remained silent, his mother Randi publicly thanked fans for their prayers and support. As Mahomes begins a lengthy rehabilitation, the Chiefs face a rare playoff miss but remain optimistic about his full recovery and return in 2026.

title: Watch: Nagar Kirtan dirupted in NZ; Sikh leader flags 'threat to religious freedom'
content: Shiromani Akali Dal president Sukhbir Singh Badal condemned the disruption of a peaceful Sikh Nagar Kirtan in New Zealand, calling it a threat to religious freedom and universal brotherhood. He praised the Sikh community for maintaining restraint despite provocation and urged external affairs minister S Jaishankar to raise the issue with the New Zealand government, as police intervened to ensure the procession could continue safely.

title: 'His injuries have been strange': Gavaskar on Gill's omission from WC squad
content: Shubman Gill was dropped from India‚Äôs T20 World Cup 2026 squad due to poor form and injury concerns. Sunil Gavaskar advised Gill to take the decision positively and assured his future remains bright. Gavaskar called the move a ‚Äúcourse correction,‚Äù adding that chief selector Ajit Agarkar would explain the decision personally.

title: Merry Christmas 2025: Wishes, messages to share with your loved ones
content: It's Christmas time and it is probably the best time to connect with your loved ones. Here is a list of over 50 curated messages for the different types of relationships you have in your life. They are unique and are loaded with emotions that will resonate with your different relationships.

title: IND vs PAK Final: Naqvi presents trophy to U19 Asia Cup champs - Watch
content: Pakistan's U19 team secured a dominant 191-run victory over India in the Asia Cup final, preventing a repeat of the senior tournament's trophy presentation drama.  A stellar 172 by Sameer Minhas powered Pakistan to 347, a target India couldn't approach, falling for 156. Indian players collected medals separately, avoiding the ACC chairman.

title: Watch: What RSS chief said on live-in relationships & how many children to have
content: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat, speaking in Kolkata, voiced concerns about live-in relationships, deeming them an unwillingness to accept responsibility. He suggested renunciation for those avoiding marriage. Bhagwat also shared insights from experts, recommending early marriage (19-25) and three children for health and ego management, while acknowledging his personal lack of experience in these matters.

title: Mountains older than memory: How new 'definition' of Aravalli risks eroding 'Viksit Bharat'
content: India's ancient Aravalli Range faces a new definition crisis after a Supreme Court ruling.  The court accepted a 100-meter elevation threshold for identifying the hills, sparking concerns among environmentalists. Critics argue this narrow view ignores the range's vital ecological functions, potentially opening it to unchecked mining and real estate development, threatening water security and climate stability.

title: The Watchlist: Why It's a Wonderful Life is the perfect movie to restore your faith in humanity
content: A late-night viewing of 'It's a Wonderful Life' offered unexpected solace and a profound reminder of life's value. The film beautifully portrays George Bailey's selfless nature and his struggle with perceived failure. Through a guardian angel's intervention, George realizes the immense impact of his quiet sacrifices, highlighting the significance of every life and the power of gratitude.

title: U19 Asia Cup: India fold for 156; Pakistan win final by 191 runs to lift trophy
content: India suffered a crushing 191-run defeat to Pakistan in the U-19 Asia Cup final. Chasing a daunting 348, India collapsed to 156 all out. Pakistan bowlers didn't give away and bowled tight lines from the beginning. Fast bowler Ali Raza took 4 wickets, including Ayush Mhatre, and Vaibhav Sooryavanshi. While Mohammad Sayyam, Abdul Subhan, Huzaifa Ahsan took 2 wickets each.‚Äã‚Äã

title: BJP-led NDA won 2-0 in 2025 elections, can opposition bounce back in 2026?
content: Following BJP's 2025 victories in Delhi and Bihar, 2026 presents a crucial comeback opportunity for the opposition. Key contests in West Bengal, Kerala, Tamil Nadu, Assam, and Puducherry will test incumbent governments and emerging political forces, with updated electoral rolls adding another layer of intrigue to these significant state elections.

title: IND vs PAK final: Heated! Mhatre confronts Pakistan bowler ‚Äì Watch
content: India's U19 Asia Cup final against Pakistan in Dubai included a heated exchange after captain Ayush Mhatre's early dismissal. Pakistan posted a formidable 347, thanks to Sameer Minhas's 172, putting India under immense pressure. Mhatre's quick exit and subsequent on-field confrontation added to the intense rivalry, as India struggled in their chase.

title: ‚ÄòSecond killing of Gandhi‚Äô: Chidambaram hits out at Centre over VB-G RAM G bill, calls it fraud
content: Senior Congress leader P Chidambaram strongly criticized the Centre's move to replace MGNREGA, calling it the "second killing of Mahatma Gandhi." He stated the party will oppose the new VB-G RAM G bill until the original employment guarantee framework is restored, vowing to expose the alleged fraud.

title: Exports to US rebound in Nov amid supply-chain shifts & holiday restocking: GTRI
content: India's exports to the US rebounded in November after two months of continuous decline. growing by 22.61% to reach $6.98 billion. This was largely driven by upply-chain adjustments and pre-holiday season inventory restocking, according to the Global Trade Research Initiative (GTRI). The trade data shows imports from the US also grew significantly, jumping 38.29 per cent to $5.25 billion during the month.

title: 'Might change name': Cong taunts BJP over rlys fare hike; slams increasing travel prices
content: Congress MP Ranjeet Ranjan criticized the Union government's recent railway fare hike, stating it will burden the middle and lower middle class before the Union budget. She slammed the increase of Rs 10 per 500 km, impacting long-distance travel costs significantly.

title: 3-state crime spree: How gang used Google maps to plan burglaries
content: Police in Jamshedpur have arrested a gang of thieves who utilized Google Maps to scout and target homes for burglaries across Jharkhand, West Bengal, and Bihar. The trio, apprehended after a break-in in Golmuri, were found with stolen gold, a firearm, and tools used for their crimes. They have been placed in judicial custody.

title: 'Chilling message': Cong slams Bihar guv for defending Nitish; hijab row intensifies
content: Congress criticizes Bihar CM Nitish Kumar for allegedly violating a young woman's bodily autonomy during an appointment letter distribution event. A video showed Kumar questioning a doctor's naqab, which the Congress leader described as an attempt to normalize unwanted touch from influential men. The doctor has since not reported for duty.

title: VB-G Ram G: President gives assent to Bill; oppn slams new jobs scheme
content: President Droupadi Murmu has approved the Viksit Bharat‚ÄîGuarantee for Rozgar and Ajeevika Mission (Gramin) Bill, 2025, replacing the MGNREGA. The new law guarantees 125 days of wage employment annually to rural households volunteering for unskilled manual work, aligning with the Viksit Bharat 2047 vision. Opposition parties have criticized the move, citing concerns over undermining Mahatma Gandhi's legacy.

title: T20 WC squad: Gambhir asked about Gill omission at airport - Watch
content: India revealed its T20 World Cup 2026 squad. Shubman Gill's exclusion surprised many. Ishan Kishan's strong domestic form earned him a spot. Chief selector Ajit Agarkar cited Gill's lack of runs. Captain Suryakumar Yadav emphasized the need for an aggressive opening wicketkeeper. The selection signals a focus on attacking players for the upcoming tournament.

title: B'desh unrest: India rebuts Dhaka media's 'propaganda'; flags atrocities against minorities
content: India has dismissed Bangladeshi media reports as "misleading propaganda" regarding a protest outside its High Commission in New Delhi. The demonstration, involving a small group, protested the killing of a minority member in Mymensingh. India is monitoring the situation in Bangladesh and has conveyed strong concerns over minority atrocities, urging justice for the victim.

title: Messi got Rs 89cr for India tour, govt Rs 11cr as tax: Organiser blames ‚Äòinfluential' people
content: Event organizer Satadru Dutta was arrested following chaos during the Messi tour in Kolkata. Police seized Rs 22 crore from his accounts, suspecting black money use. Dutta claimed Rs 100 crore was spent, but investigators doubt his financial figures. He also blamed others for the event's disorder, citing pressures for increased access.

title: 'Huge mistake': Bhagwat on viewing RSS through BJP lens; clarifies objective of outfit
content: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat said that understanding the Sangh through the BJP lens is a ‚Äúhuge mistake‚Äù and stressed that the organisation has no political agenda. Addressing programmes in Kolkata, he said the RSS should not be compared to political or service organisations and works for the betterment and protection of Hindu society, calling for opinions about the Sangh to be based on facts rather than narratives.

title: 'I don‚Äôt wanna be alive': Tom Brady‚Äôs post sparks mental health concerns
content: Following news of Gisele B√ºndchen's marriage to Joaquim Valente, Tom Brady shared a song on Instagram with lyrics about mental health struggles and suicidal thoughts, sparking fan concern. The couple, who welcomed a baby earlier this year, reportedly began dating in June 2023. Brady's song choice, Logic's '1-800-273-8255', has raised questions about his state of mind.

title: Stock market activity possibly muted for the week; what experts said
content: Stock markets have to brace for a cautious start to the week, influenced by foreign investor activity and global economic cues. A shortened trading week due to Christmas may also result in subdued volumes. Experts anticipate a range-bound market with a positive bias, driven by renewed FII interest and a slight INR recovery, as investors eye upcoming Q3 earnings.

title: How the Indian education system is responding to high AQI and cold waves
content: North Indian schools are adapting to winter challenges, with hazardous air quality and cold waves forcing changes. Delhi-NCR schools are shifting to online and hybrid models under GRAP IV. Uttar Pradesh districts are closing schools due to fog and cold, while Bihar is revising timings to safeguard students. These measures prioritize health amidst extreme weather.

title: Not Bishop or Simon Doull: Fans give pitch report during NZ vs WI Test - Watch
content: Fans offered their opinions on the Mount Maunganui pitch, a role typically for experts, as New Zealand built a commanding lead against the West Indies. Centuries from Latham and Conway bolstered New Zealand's position, setting a challenging target of 462 after bowling out the West Indies for 420 and declaring their second innings at 306/2.

title: Train travel gets costlier: Here is how much your ticket will cost now
content: Indian Railways will implement a revised fare structure from December 26 to address rising operational and manpower costs. Passengers traveling beyond 215 km in Ordinary Class will see a 1 paise per kilometer increase, while Mail and Express non-AC and AC coaches will face a 2 paise per kilometer hike. Suburban and monthly season tickets remain unchanged.

title: San Francisco blackout: Power outage leaves nearly a third of city in darkness
content: San Francisco faced a massive power outage on Saturday, impacting over 124,000 customers and disrupting daily life just before Christmas. A fire at a PG&E substation was identified as the cause, leading to widespread closures of businesses and transit. Power restoration efforts were underway overnight.

title: Transfer portal: Tracking who intends to move
content: College football's transfer portal officially opens at midnight ET on Jan. 2. However, players have been announcing their intentions to transfer since the regular season ended. Once the portal opens, players have until Jan. 16 to enter their name to transfer. It doesn't mean they have to find their new schools by then -- or that they can't return to their previous schools. We are tracking the notable players entering the portal as well as those players who will re-sign with their current schools. Here's the latest news and updates on how the 2026 season could be transformed.

title: Betting lines for each CFP quarterfinal, other bowl games

title: Inside the Bears' wild comeback win over the Packers in OT
content: the Bears had a 16-9 lead and a 96.9% chance of winning the key NFC North battle . it wasn't that his onside kick was remarkable, it was not handled by Packers receiver Romeo Doubs . at that point, the Packers' win percentage had dipped to 86.9% .

title: College Football Playoff 2025: Quarterfinal first look
content: the canes beat Texas A&M thanks to an interception in the end zone in the final seconds of the game, and they will play Ohio State in the Cotton Bowl . the cotton bowls will be played on Jan. 1 and will be held on Dec. 31 .

title: Questions, takeaways: Resilient Bears pull out OT thriller; Eagles repeat as NFC East champs
content: Chicago erases a 10-point fourth-quarter deficit to beat the Packers in overtime and jump into first place in the NFC North . the Bears pulled out an OT win over the Packers, who suffered a concussion . our reporters reacted to all the action, answering lingering questions coming out of each game .

title: MLB offseason grades: White Sox hit home run, land Japan's Murakami
content: the 2025-26 offseason is officially here, and we have you covered with grades and analysis for every major signing and trade this winter . if it's a big-money free agent signing that changes the course of your team's future or a blockbuster trade, we'll weigh in with what it all means for next season and beyond .
